channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024071782
item.description:
Report X-2024071782

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared no-spill. Five 250 ml plastic bottles of Ninja Glue Hybrid, a UN1133 flammable, were discovered while searching package for shipping information. No hazmat markings on outer carton. Also in carton is one box of 100 steel fasteners. No spillage occurred.

item.title: Report X-2024071768
item.description:
Report X-2024071768

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release during the loading process at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained two metal can with positive closure rings. both cans were dented but the closure ring came off of one can causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024070519
item.description:
Report E-2024070519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide was damaged by a load shift and released approximately 300-gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE crews utilized neutralizer throughout the trailer and on the concrete below, then deployed granular absorbents to the trailer and concrete, working them in with hand tools. utilized a forklift to transfer the remaining contents in the damaged tote into new one. All sodium hydroxide-impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 5th a package was found during the AM sort that was leaking. The package contained UN1263, Paint Related Material, 3, III. The chime on one of the cans was dented, causing the liquid to spill out of the can. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers dec.

  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure rings and inside of plastic bags. One of the metal cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024071198
item.description:
Report X-2024071198

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-14
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that multiple content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles

  • Description: On July 7th a package was found during the AM sort that was leaking. The package contained four 1-Gallon cans of paint that did not have secondary closures to ensure the cans did not leak. The contents of the cans were classified as UN1263, PAINT, 3, III. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070399
item.description:
Report E-2024070399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, three (3) 2-gallon containers of UN1760 were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the concrete surfaces of the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were contained in six (6) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans that all had positive closure rings, inside of plastic bags and separated by fiberboard dividers. One of the cans was received a dent in the body that caused the lid to open and spill it's contents. All items were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024071032

Report X-2024071032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass jars wrapped in layers of brown paper and taped closed with Styrofoam peanuts foe dunnage. A lid on one of the jars was not sealed properly and that was the cause of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024070410
item.description:
Report E-2024070410

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 50-gallons of Spectrum 22 released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS reviewed the SDS and dispatched HEPACO to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 40ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and asphalt underneath the trailer and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to an unknown reason from one (1) 330-gallon tote. The fire department was on site and blocking the spill with absorbents. HEPACO personnel transferred the remaining material in the tote to vented poly drums. HEPACO thoroughly cleaned all impacted surfaces. The waste and damaged tote was containerized into poly drums for disposal.
